intro: Carduus × variabilis, commonly known as the variable thistle, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pinkish flowers, which are typically arranged in a composite flower head. The plant is native to Europe and has been introduced to various parts of the world, often growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. The variable thistle is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its distinctive appearance and ability to thrive in a range of environmental conditions.
